lines.text:
[a student approaches Lee; both bow]
Kick me.
What was that? An Exhibition? We need emotional content. Now try again!
I said "emotional content." Not anger! Now try again!
That's it! How did it feel?
Don't think. FEEEEEEEEL! It's like a finger pointing away to the moon.
[Lee looks at student who is looking at the finger; Lee smacks student again]
Do not concentrate on the finger or you will miss all of the heavenly glory!
Never take your eyes off your opponent... even when you're bowing!
[Student bows again this time keeping his eyes on Lee]
I see your talents have gone beyond the mere physical level. Your skills are now at the point of spiritual insight. I have several questions. What is the highest technique you hope to achieve ?
Very good. What are your thoughts when facing an opponent ?
Because the word "I" does not exist.

A good fight should be like a small play, but played seriously. A good martial artist does not become tense, but ready. Not thinking, yet not dreaming. Ready for whatever may come. When the opponent expands, I contract. When he contracts, I expand. And when there is an opportunity, I do not hit. It hits all by itself.
the enemy has only images and illusions behind which he hides his true motives. Destroy the image and you will break the enemy.
Man, you come right out of a comic book.
My style? You can call it the art of fighting without fighting.
The art of fighting without fighting? Show me some of it.
[Parsons grabs Lees shoulder as he turns away]
Don't you think we need more room?
That island, on the beach. We can take this boat.
[Oharra throws a board in the air and smashes it with his fist]
You have offended my family and you have offended the Shaolin Temple.
Mr. Han, suddenly I wish to leave your island.
Why doesn't somebody pull out a .45 and, bang, settle it?

Sparta, Rome, The Knights of Europe, the Samurai... They worshipped strength, because it is strength that makes all other values possible. Nothing survives without it. Who knows what delicate wonders have died out of the world, for want of the strength to survive.
[Roper sees Tania for the first time]
Would you look at that? A woman like that could teach you a lot about yourself.
Hello Mr. Lee. My name's Braithwaite.
Well, well. One more lovely than the next.
Ghettoes are the same all over the world. They stink.
We are all ready to win, just as we are born knowing only life. It is defeat that you must learn to prepare for.
I don't waste my time with it. When it comes, I won't even notice.
I'll be too busy looking gooood.
It's the dough Roper, or we gotta break something! You got it? Freddy says this is for your own good.
You will not agree with what I'm going to do. It is contrary to all that you have taught me, and all that Su Lin believed. I must leave. Please try to find a way to forgive me.
Good morning, Mr. Roper. We have been waiting for you.
Would you be good enough to participate in this morning's edification?
[Roper sees Lee tied with arms behind his back]

[to Han]
What are you going to do to him?
Very few people can be totally ruthless. It isn't easy; it takes more strength than you might believe.
So! There is a point you will not go beyond.
We are investing in corruption, Mr Roper. The business of corruption is like any other.
Oh yeah! Provide your customers with products they need and, uh, charge a little bit to stimulate your market and before you know it customers come to depend on you, I mean really need you.
Please understand, if I missed anyone,
it's been a big day. I'm a little tired.

[a knock on the door]
Come in.
If you don't see anything you like...
There was a girl at the feast tonight.

[takes out a dart]
The owner of this dart.
Oh, yes. I know the one. I'll send her to you.
A man's strength can be measured by his appetites. Indeed, a man's strength *flows* from his appetites.
Only at how sloppy your man works.
the enemy has only images and illusions behind which he hides his true motives. Destroy the image and you will break the enemy.
You have offended my family, and you have offended the Shaolin temple.

Gentlemen, welcome. You honor our island. I look forward to a tournament of truly epic proportions. We are unique, gentlemen, in that we create ourselves... through long years of rigorous training, sacrifice, denial, pain. We forge our bodies in the fire of our will. But tonight, let us celebrate. Gentlemen, you have our gratitude.
Mr. Lee, I've come to talk to you about a tournament of martial arts. A tournament to which you've already received an invitation. Specifically, the tournament organized by Mr. Han.
I know, I know, I know. But we'd very much like you to attend THAT particular tournament, Mr. Lee.

[on the phone]
Hello, put your colonel on.
I don't care if he's not alone!
[another pause, this time Braithwaite is apparently angry at the people he's talking to]
Damn it all, I don't care who he's with! You bloody well put him on the line!

[Roper is betting on insect fighting and loses]
For crying out loud! Do you believe that?
You must attend the morning ritual in uniform.

[about Lee's sister]
Now you know the truth. When you get to the city, pay your respects to your sister and your mother.
The battle with the guards was magnificent. Your skill is extraordinary. And I was going to ask you to join us.
What's the matter? You on a diet?
I'd like to eat, if I can find something I can keep down.
Hello, Mr. Lee. My name is Braithwaite.
I've come to speak to you about a matter of great importance.

[referring to a stewardess found at the harbor]
What did the autopsy reveal as the cause of death?
[checks his folder and puts on his reading glasses]
Er, yes. Cause of death was, uh... heroin overdose.
